member.name: M:ZennoLab.InterfacesLibrary.ProjectModel.Collections.IProfile.Save(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Save the profile data to file.

param.name: path
param.para: A path to file for the profile data. File extension should be .zpprofile, otherwise this extension will be added to the path.

param.name: saveProxy
param.para: The true if need to save proxy information; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: savePlugins
param.para: The true if need to save plugins information; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveLocalStorage
param.para: The true if need to save local storage information; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveTimezone
param.para: The true if need to save time zone information; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveGeoposition
param.para: The true if need to save geo information; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveSuperCookie
param.para: The true if need to save HSTS super cookie; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveFonts
param.para: The true if need to save font list; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveWebRtc
param.para: The true if need to save webrtc settings; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveIndexedDb
param.para: The true if need to save indexedDB; otherwise and default, false.

param.name: saveVariables
param.para: The array of variable names if need to save Variables; otherwise and default, null.

member.remarks: You should remember that all ZennoPoster's structures, actions and methods uses the utf-8 encoding.

requirements.para: Target Platforms: Desktop: Windows XP SP3 and older. Server: Windows Server 2003 and older.

member.name: M:ZennoLab.InterfacesLibrary.Spintax.ICommonSpintaxModuleV2Interface.SpinTheArticleV2(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: accepts your orignial text and returns a rewrite of the text
member.param: The text that you would like WordAi to rewrite. Cannot be empty. When rewrite_num is set between 1 to 4, maximum words for input is 5000. When rewrite_num is set between 5 to 10, maximum words for input is 1000.
The number of rewrites you'd like WordAi to create for your original text. rewrite_num must be an integer ranging from 1 to 10. Default is 1.

Depend on how conservative vs adventurous you want your rewrite to be, you can set uniqueness as an integer ranging from 1 to 3, where 1 stands for More Conservative, 2 stands for Regular, and 3 stands for More Adventurous. Default is 1.

Set to true if you want to receive a list of rewrites of the text you provided (size of the list is the same as true you provide). Otherwise, the output returned will be the spintax of your text. If set to true, a new key rewrites is added to result, whose value is an array of rewrites.
Default is false. Set to true to use the protect words master settings in your account, which can be viewed and updated here.
Default is false. Set to true to use the custom synonyms master settings in your account, which can be viewed and updated here.
Return Json instead text (There are no any exception).
